verses.text: For, behold, the Lord , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff , the whole stay of bread , and the whole stay of water ,
The mighty man , and the man of war , the judge , and the prophet , and the prudent , and the ancient ,

The captain of fifty , and the honourable man , and the counsellor , and the cunning artificer , and the eloquent orator.\f + \fr 3.3 \ft the honourable…: Heb. a man eminent in countenance\f*\f + \fr 3.3 \ft eloquent…: or, skilful of speech\f*
And I will give children \add to be\add* their princes , and babes shall rule over them.
And the people shall be oppressed , every one by another , and every one by his neighbour : the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient , and the base against the honourable.
When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father , \add saying\add*, Thou hast clothing , be thou our ruler , and \add let\add* this ruin \add be\add* under thy hand :

In that day shall he swear , saying , I will not be an healer ; for in my house \add is\add* neither bread nor clothing : make me not a ruler of the people.\f + \fr 3.7 \ft swear: Heb. lift up the hand\f*\f + \fr 3.7 \ft healer: Heb. binder up\f*
For Jerusalem is ruined , and Judah is fallen : because their tongue and their doings \add are\add* against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, to provoke the eyes of his glory. \p
¶ The shew of their countenance doth witness against them ; and they declare their sin as Sodom , they hide \add it\add* not. Woe unto their soul ! for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.
Say ye to the righteous , that \add it shall be\add* well \add with him:\add* for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
Woe unto the wicked ! \add it shall be\add* ill \add with him:\add* for the reward of his hands shall be given him.\f + \fr 3.11 \ft given…: Heb. done to him\f* \p

¶ \add As for\add* my people , children \add are\add* their oppressors , and women rule over them. O my people , they which lead thee cause \add thee\add* to err , and destroy the way of thy paths.\f + \fr 3.12 \ft lead…: or, call thee blessed\f*\f + \fr 3.12 \ft destroy: Heb. swallow up\f*
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* standeth up to plead , and standeth to judge the people.

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people , and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard ; the spoil of the poor \add is\add* in your houses.\f + \fr 3.14 \ft eaten: or, burnt\f*
What mean ye \add that\add* ye beat my people to pieces , and grind the faces of the poor ? saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* of hosts. \p

¶ Moreover the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* saith , Because the daughters of Zion are haughty , and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes , walking and mincing \add as\add* they go , and making a tinkling with their feet :\f + \fr 3.16 \ft wanton…: Heb. deceiving with their eyes\f*\f + \fr 3.16 \ft mincing: or, tripping nicely\f*

Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will discover their secret parts.\f + \fr 3.17 \ft discover: Heb. make naked\f*

In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of \add their\add* tinkling ornaments \add about their feet\add*, and \add their\add* cauls , and \add their\add* round tires like the moon ,\f + \fr 3.18 \ft cauls: or, networks\f*
The chains , and the bracelets , and the mufflers ,\f + \fr 3.19 \ft chains: or, sweet balls\f*\f + \fr 3.19 \ft mufflers: or, spangled ornaments\f*
The bonnets , and the ornaments of the legs , and the headbands , and the tablets , and the earrings ,\f + \fr 3.20 \ft tablets: Heb. houses of the soul\f*
The rings , and nose jewels ,
The changeable suits of apparel , and the mantles , and the wimples , and the crisping pins ,
The glasses , and the fine linen , and the hoods , and the vails.

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* instead of sweet smell there shall be stink ; and instead of a girdle a rent ; and instead of well set hair baldness ; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth ; \add and\add* burning instead of beauty.
Thy men shall fall by the sword , and thy mighty in the war.\f + \fr 3.25 \ft mighty: Heb. might\f*
And her gates shall lament and mourn ; and she \add being\add* desolate shall sit upon the ground.\f + \fr 3.26 \ft desolate: or, emptied: Heb. cleansed\f*
